intro: Pedicularis siifolia, commonly known as the Siberian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
